metadata.title: CVE-2010-1160 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
GNU nano before 2.2.4 does not verify whether a file has been changedbefore it is overwritten in a file-save operation, which allows localuser-assisted attackers to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attackon an attacker-owned file that is being edited by the victim.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-1160` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nano - 2.2.4-1
nano-tiny - 2.2.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nano package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.4-1').
